episode_title: 504 - The One Where Phoebe Hates PBS

content.description: Monica and Rachel’s, Rachel has just gotten home and is going through the mail. She finds something that’s Monica’s and goes over and knocks on her closed bedroom door.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Come in. I’ve been waiting for you.
(Rachel enters.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hi! I just wanna-(sees Monica)-Ahhh!!! Oh my God! (She runs out in horror.) Oh my God!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Okay, I’m sorry! I’m sorry! I-I-I was um, I was taking a nap.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Since when do take naps in that position. Oh God Monica, tell me you were waiting for a guy! Please tell me you were waiting for a guy!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Yes. Yes, I was. A guy. From work. (Thinks) I’m seeing a guy from work! Ha!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: That cute waiter guy from your restaurant, the one that looks like a non-threatening Ray Liotta?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Uh-huh, that one!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Y’know what, just give me a second and I’ll be out of your hair. I’m just gonna grab a jacket. When I get back, I want every little detail. (There’s a knock on the door.) Maybe that’s him. (Goes to answer the door.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Okay, umm, okay, umm… (Rachel opens the door.) It’s just Joey and Ross.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Why aren’t you guys at the movie?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Well, we were! But Ross was talking so loud on his phone they threw us out!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I had to talk loud because the movie was loud!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: He’s talking to London!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: But why?! Did he get in touch with Emily?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Well no, not yet. He’s calling everyone on her side of the family hoping that someone will help him get in touch with her.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I-I-I don’t care if I said some other girl’s name you prissy, old twit!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Ross! Way to suck up to the family.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Ha-ha-ha-(sees everyone)-enh-enh. I’m so glad you guys are all here! My office finally got wrinkle free fax paper!
content.parenthetical: entering, happily, with a bottle of champagne, thinking that Monica is the only one there

content.description: Monica and Rachel’s, the next morning, Phoebe, Chandler, Ross, and Monica are eating breakfast.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh no-no-no-no-no-no, vomit tux! No-no, vomit tux!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Don’t worry, I had it dry-cleaned.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Vomit tux? Who vomited on—y’know what, what you up to Joe?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Well, I’m doing this telethon thing on TV and my agent got me a job as co-host!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh that’s great!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: A little uh, good deed for PBS and a little TV exposure, now that’s the kind of math Joey likes to do!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Ugh, PBS!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: What’s wrong with PBS?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Ugh, what’s right with them?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Why don’t you like PBS, Pheebs?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Okay, ’cause right after my mom killed herself, I was just in this really bad place, y’know personally. So, I just thought that it’d make me feel better if I wrote to Sesame Street , ’cause they were so nice when I was a little kid! No one ever wrote back.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Well y’know a lot of those Muppets don’t have thumbs.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: All I got was a lousy key chain! And by that time I was living in a box. I didn’t have keys!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I’m sorry Pheebs, I just, y’know, I just wanted to do a good deed. Like-like you did with the babies.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: This isn’t a good deed, you just wanted to get on TV! This is totally selfish.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Whoa! Whoa! Whoa! What about you, having those babies for your brother? Talk about selfish!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: What-what are you talking about?!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Well, yeah, it was a really nice thing and all, but it made you feel really good right?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yeah. So?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: It made you feel good, so that makes it selfish. Look, there’s no unselfish good deeds, sorry.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yes there are! There are totally good deeds that are selfless.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Well, may I ask for one example?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yeah, it’s… Y’know there’s—no you may not!
(They are standing on either side of Chandler as they discuss the point. Chandler, meanwhile, is disgusted with the whole argument.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: That’s because all people are selfish.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Are you calling me selfish?!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Are you calling you people? (Chandler rolls his eyes.) Yeah, well sorry to burst that bubble, Pheebs, but selfless good deeds don’t exist. Okay? And you the deal on Santa Clause right?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: I’m gonna find a selfless good dead. I’m gonna beat you, you evil genius.
(Ross’s phone rings and he answers it.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hello.

content.speaker: Emily
content.text: Hello, Ross?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Emily? Emily! Oh my God! Oh my God, it’s Emily! (He picks up a lamp and hands it to Chandler, for no reason.) It’s Emily everyone! Shush-shush-shhst! (to Emily) Hi!

content.speaker: Emily
content.text: Ross, I’m only ringing to say stop harassing my relatives. Good-bye!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: No wait! Look, wait! Okay, you can hang up, but I’m gonna keep calling! I’m gonna, I’m gonna call everyone in England if that’s what it takes to get you to talk to me!

content.speaker: Emily
content.text: Really? About what?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Look you’re my wife. We’re-we’re married. Y’know? I-I love you. I-I really miss you.

content.speaker: Emily
content.text: I miss you to. Well, at least I think I do.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: She’s talking.

content.speaker: All
content.text: Yay! (He motions for them to keep quiet, including Chandler who is still holding the lamp Ross handed him, before he goes off to talk to Emily in private.)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Hey, Joey, when you said the deal with Santa Clause, you meant?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: That he doesn’t exist.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Right. (She turns and opens her eyes in shock.)

content.description: Central Perk, Chandler, Monica, and Rachel are there.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: So Chandler, have you heard about Monica’s secret boyfriend?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Uhh, yeah. She uh, she uh, she uh might’ve mentioned him.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: So Mon, when are we gonna meet this new secret waiter man?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Ohh, he’s really shy. I-I don’t think he’s up to meeting everyone yet.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yeah, I don’t think he’s up to meeting everyone yet.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I don’t care! I wanna meet this guy who’s the best sex she ever had!
(Chandler is quite pleased with that statement.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Really?! That’s what you heard? (To Monica) You said that?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I might’ve said that. (Chandler laughs.) Why is that funny?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Because I’m very happy for him! (To Monica) And you , you lucky dog!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hi!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Well, Emily’s willing to work on the relationship.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yes!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: That’s great!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: In London!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: What?!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: She wants me to move to London.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: But you live here! (Ross rolls his eyes.) You know that.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: What-what-what are you gonna do?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I bet if I talk to Carol and Susan I can convince them to move to London with Ben.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Yeah, I’m sure your ex-wife will be more than happy to move to another country so you can patch things up with your new wife.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: It could happen.

content.description: Unitel Video, Studio 55, Joey’s telethon, he is being shown around by the stage director.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: How ya doin’? Welcome. Good to see ya!

content.speaker: Stage Director
content.text: This will be your phone.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: That’s great. But uh, I’m not really expecting a lot of calls.

content.speaker: Stage Director
content.text: No you answer it and take pledges.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: But I’m the host!

content.speaker: Stage Director
content.text: No, Gary Collins is the host. You’ll be answering the phones.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: You don’t seem to understand. See, I was Dr. Drake Remoray.

content.speaker: Stage Director
content.text: Well, here’s your phone doctor. (She walks away.)

content.description: Monica and Rachel’s, Phoebe, Rachel, and Monica are there.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: I cannot believe I can’t find a selfless good deed! Y’know that old guy that lives next to me? Well, I snuck over there and-and raked up all the leaves on his front stoop. But he caught me and force-fed me cider and cookies. Then I felt wonderful. That old jackass!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Maybe Joey’s right. Maybe all good deeds are selfish.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: I will find a selfless good deed! ’Cause I just gave birth to three children and I will not let them be raised in a world where Joey is right!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Hey, Monica? Can I ask you a cooking question?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Sure!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: If you’re cooking on the stove, does that mean that your new secret boyfriend is better in bed than Richard?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Chandler! (Pause) Is he?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Well, y’know I-I-I think I’m gonna respect the privacy of my new secret boyfriend.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Why?! I mean if this guy was me and it was me who had learned that it was me who was the best you’d ever had, I’d be going like this. (He jumps up onto the table and starts doing his happy dance.)

content.description: Ross’s apartment, he’s on the phone with Emily.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: All right Emily, as much as I love you, I’m sorry, I can’t move to London without Ben.

content.speaker: Emily
content.text: I understand that would be difficult.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yeah, would you please consider moving here? I mean you were gonna move here anyway, why can’t you just do that?

content.speaker: Emily
content.text: I don’t know, it’s just…

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh-oh-okay, but-but I know, that even though I’ve been a-a complete idiot up ’til now, I mean, I mean you-you-you have to come here. You have to come here so we can work this out.

content.speaker: Emily
content.text: All right.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: All right, did you just say all right?

content.speaker: Emily
content.text: I did. Now I’m the idiot.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh, Emily that is, that is so great. It’s gonna be so great! We’re gonna be like-like-like two idiots in love!
(She laughs.)

content.speaker: Emily
content.text: Ross, there’s one thing that really scares me still.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yes, tell me.

content.speaker: Emily
content.text: Well, you have to understand how humiliating it was for me up on that altar in front of my entire family, all my friends.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I know. I am, I am so sorry.

content.speaker: Emily
content.text: And then after decided to forgive you, seeing you at the airport catching our plane with her.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Again, very sorry.

content.speaker: Emily
content.text: I mean, I can’t-I can’t be in the same room as her! It drives me mad just thinking of you being in the same room as her!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Emily, there is nothing between Rachel and me. Okay? I love you.

content.speaker: Emily
content.text: All right. I’ll come to New York and we’ll try and make this work.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh that is so great! That’s…

content.speaker: Emily
content.text: As long as you don’t see Rachel anymore.

content.description: Monica and Rachel’s, Ross is telling Phoebe, Monica, and Chandler about Emily’s ultimatum.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: So I asked Emily if she would come to New York, and she said yes.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yes!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Ooh-ohh!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Great!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: No-no-no! Only if I promise never to see Rachel again.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Why?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: What?! You can’t—what did you tell her?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I told her I’d have to think about it. I mean, how the hell am I supposed to make this kind of a decision? (They’re all quiet.) I’m actually asking you!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Well, you can’t just not see Rachel anymore, she’s one of your best friends.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Yeah! But, he can’t not exactly see Emily, I mean that’s his wife.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yeah.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: That’s true!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yeah, but you’ve known Rachel since High School and you cannot just cut her out of your life.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: That’s true!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: No, you cannot.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Thanks for the help, problem solved. (Wipes his hands.)
(The phone rings.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Hello.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey Mon!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh hey Joey! We’ve been watching all day, when are you gonna be on TV?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: See, there was kind of a mix up in my agent’s office, but I’m still on TV and that’s good exposure.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: You’re not on TV.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh, uh, okay, how, how about now? (He waves his hand in front of the woman next to him and you can now see his arm on TV.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Hey, there he is! There he is!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hello New York! (The woman bats his hand out of the way.)

content.description: Chandler and Joey’s, the chick and the duck are watching Emeril Live, a cooking show.

content.speaker: Emeril
content.text: Now maybe you just like wanna but the whole duck in there! Who cares, y’know? Now I got the legs…
(Chandler enters and sees what they’re watching, panics, and runs to turn off the TV.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: How many times have I told you guys, you never watch the cooking channel!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Hi Chandler.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Uh, listen, I need that broiling pan that Joey borrowed the other day.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh that was yours? Uh, yeah, we used it when the duck was throwing up caterpillars.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: William Sonoma , fall catalog, Page 27.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Expect it in 4-6 weeks. (She starts to leave.) Umm, hey, umm, Joey’s gonna be at the telethon for the rest of the day, we have the whole place to ourselves.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Yeah, so?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Well I just, thought maybe you’d wanna book some time with the best you’d ever had.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Y’know what, champ? I think I’ll pass.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Why?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Why? (She hops into the living room and imitates Chandler’s happy dance.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: What’s your point?

content.description: The Telethon, Joey’s phone rings and he answers it.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: PBS telethon.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Hey Joey, I just wanted to let you know that I found a selfless good deed. I just went down to the park and I let a bee sting me.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: What?! What good is that gonna do anybody?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Well, it helps the bee look tough in front of his bee friends. The bee is happy and I am definitely not.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Now, y’know the bee probably died after he stung ya.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Aw, dammit! (Slams the phone down.)

content.speaker: Stage Director
content.text: Back on in 30 seconds people!
(Joey gets up and moves to the other end of his row to talk to the guy sitting there.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey, excuse me, would you mind switching with me?

content.speaker: PBS Volunteer
content.text: Hey, no way, I’m in the shot man.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Come on man! You’ve been here all day!

content.speaker: PBS Volunteer
content.text: Yeah, I-I’m taking pledges here, eh?

content.speaker: Stage Director
content.text: We’re on in 3, 2, (points to Gary Collins.)

content.speaker: Gary Collins
content.text: Welcome back to our fall telethon. Now if you’ve been enjoying the performance of Cirque Du Soleil , (As he is speaking, Joey and the volunteer getting into a shoving match.) and you’d like to see more of the same kind of programming, it’s very simple. All you have to do (Joey is knocked down.) is call in your pledge and at that time tell the operator, one of our volunteers, what kind of programming you’d like to… (Just as the volunteer sits down, Joey pulls him to the ground.)

content.description: Monica and Rachel’s, Monica and Phoebe are cooking, Chandler is reading a magazine.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Okay, that’s it. I cannot make this decision! It is too difficult, so I’m just gonna leave it entirely to the gods of fate. (He holds up and starts shaking a…)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: A Magic Eight ball?! You can’t be serious, you can’t make this decision with a toy!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Ooh, it’s not a toy.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Well, I don’t know what else to do. I mean, I either keep my wife and lose one of my-my-my best friends or I keep my friend and get divorced the second time before I’m 30! So-so if anyone has-has a better suggestion, let’s hear it! ’Cause I-I got nothing! All right, don’t be shy, any suggestion will do. (There are none.) Okay then. Here we go. Magic 8 Ball, should I never see Rachel again? (He turns it over and reads the answer) Ask again later. Later is not good enough. (He shakes it up again and reads the answer.) Ask again later. What the hell! This is broken! It-it is broken!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: All right, let me see. (She grabs the 8 ball.) Will Chandler have sex tonight? (Reads the answer.) Don’t count on it. Seems like it works to me.

content.description: The Telethon, Joey answers his ringing phone.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: PBS Telethon.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Hi Joey.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey Pheebs!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: I would like to make a pledge. I would like to donate $200.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: $200? Are you sure Pheebs? I mean, after what Sesame Street did to ya?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh, I’m still mad at them but I also now that they bring happiness to lots of kids who’s moms didn’t kill themselves, so by supporting them, I’m doing a good thing, but I’m not happy about it. So there, a selfless good deed.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: And you don’t a little good about donating the money?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: No, it sucks. I was saving up to buy a hamster.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: A hamster? What, those things are like 10 bucks.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yeah, not the one I had my eye on.

content.speaker: Gary Collins
content.text: It looks like we have surpassed last year’s pledge total! Thank you viewers! The pledge that did it was taken by one of our volunteers…(He walks over to where Joey is sitting.) Oh boy! And may I say one of our sharpest dressed volunteers, (Joey stands up.) Mr. Joseph Tribbiani!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh, look-look, Joey’s on TV! Isn’t that great? My pledge got Joey on TV! Oh that makes me feel—Oh no! (Realizes that her deed made her happy and therefore it’s selfish and covers her mouth in horror.)

content.description: Monica and Rachel’s, later that day. Monica is coming out of the bathroom carrying her cleaning gear.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Look, maybe I got carried away before. But there’s something you gotta know. If I’m the best, it’s only because you’ve made me the best.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Keep talking.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I mean I was nothing before you. Call the other girls and ask. Which wouldn’t take long. But when I’m with you, and we’re together, OH…MY…GOD.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Really?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh-aw my God! Now, I understand if you never want to sleep with me again, but that would be wrong. We’re too good! We owe it, to sex!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Well, if we owe it? (She throws down her cleaning stuff and jumps into his arms.) Oh my… When is Joey gonna be home?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Well, I was kinda hoping we could do this without him. (She starts to take off her latex gloves.) Oh no-no-no, leave the gloves on.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: But, I just cleaned the bathroom.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yeah, why don’t we lose the gloves.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Yeah. (She takes them off.)
(He carries her over to the door and opens it.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: All right, let’s show them how it’s done.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Okay.
(He starts to carry her into the hallway but hits her head on the door.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Ow!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Y’know that wasn’t part of it?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I know!
(He carries her into the hall.)

content.description: Ross’s apartment, Ross is prying at the Magic 8 Ball with a screwdriver as there’s a knock on his door which he goes to answer.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hi! Are you ready? We’re gonna be late!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: For what?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: For Stella! Remember? She’s gettin’ her grove back in like 20 minutes.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yeah, I uh, totally forgot about that. You mind if I take a rain check? I’m waiting for a call from Emily.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Sure. I guess. Hey, I hear you don’t have to go to London. Yay!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: It’s not that easy, there’s still a lot of relationship stuff.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Like what?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Just stuff. Y’know kinda what Emily wants.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Well, why don’t you talk to me about it, maybe I can help.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: No. No. You-you can’t help. I mean, I kinda have to do this without your help.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Well, I-I know you can do that too. I’m just, I’m just saying if you need somebody to talk to… Hi!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Thanks.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Ross? Look, whatever this relationship stuff that Emily wants, just give it to her. Come on, the bottom line here is that you love her. So just fix whatever she wants fixed. Just do it. (The phone starts ringing.) I mean, you’re gonna have to try. You’ll just gonna hate yourself if you don’t. (The phone keeps ringing.) Oh come on answer it! It’s driving me crazy!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hello. (Listens) Hi sweetie. (Listens.) Good. Look umm, yes I’ve been thinking about that thing that you wanted me to do and, I can do it. (Rachel gives him a thumbs up.) So will you come to New York? (Rachel wants to know what she said, and he gives her a thumbs up and she goes over and hugs him. All the time not knowing what’s going on.)

content.description: Central Perk, ??????? is playing, as Chandler peaks his head out of the storage closet and sneaks back to his seat and pretends he’s reading something. Then a short while later Monica pokes her head out of the closet and sneaks back to her seat and sits down, pretending as if nothing has happened.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Never done that before.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Nope.
